snippet: Iran has insisted that a forecast by the International Monetary Fund shows that the country’s economy is growing, but some economists said that didn’t account for the recent fall of Iran’s currency.
abstract: Iran points to new data from the International Monetary Fund forecasting an economic rebound and lower inflation in 2013 in an attempt to rebut assertions that Western sanctions have paralyzed its economy.
lead_paragraph: Iran has insisted that a forecast by the International Monetary Fund shows that the country’s economy is growing, but some economists said that didn’t account for the recent fall of Iran’s currency.

headline.seo: Iran: I.M.F. Data Prove Sanctions Aren’t Working
headline.main: Iran Cites I.M.F. Data to Prove Sanctions Aren’t Working
headline.print_headline: Iran Cites I.M.F. Data To Rebut West
